name: Funeral Potatoes (Hash Brown Casserole)
author: Peggy Warren
summary: Go figure – everyone is being good and posting healthy meals since it is the beginning of the year, and here I am tempting you with a very unhealthy dish! You may be wondering if the title was a typo. But it's not! This side dish gets it's name because it is a popular dish for luncheons after funerals. But don't worry, you can eat this creamy, cheesy side dish anytime – not just following a funeral, thank goodness.
ingredients: 1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese blend
2 (10.5 ounce) cans condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (32 ounce) package shredded hash brown potatoes
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Combine Cheddar cheese, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, 1/2 cup melted butter, and onions in a large bowl
Gently fold in hash browns and spread out in the prepared baking dish
Cover evenly with crushed corn flakes and drizzle with 2 tablespoons melted butter
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes
